intro: Chloanthes cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed chloanthes, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Chloanthes cuneata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
